types.name: Metadata
types.description:
Metadata is a map of key-value pairs, both keys and values are `String`.

Example:
```
{
    "key1": "value1",
    "key2": "value2"
}
```

fields.name: code
fields.description: The error code.

fields.name: field
fields.description: Name of a field that caused the error. A value of `null` indicates that the error isn't associated with a particular field.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: MetadataErrorCode
types.description: An enumeration.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: Key of a metadata item.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Value of a metadata item.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: Key of a metadata item.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Value of a metadata item.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key of a metadata item.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of a metadata item.

types.name: Money
types.description: Represents amount of money in specific currency.

fields.description: Amount of money.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency code.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: Amount of money.

inputFields.name: currency
inputFields.description: Currency code.

types.name: MoneyRange
types.description: Represents a range of amounts of money.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Lower bound of a price range.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Upper bound of a price range.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: The ID of the product to move.

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: The relative sorting position of the product (from -inf to +inf) starting from the first given product's actual position.1 moves the item one position forward, -1 moves the item one position backward, 0 leaves the item unchanged.

types.name: OrderAuthorizeStatusEnum
types.description:
Determine a current authorize status for order.

    We treat the order as fully authorized when the sum of authorized and charged funds
    cover the order.total.
    We treat the order as partially authorized when the sum of authorized and charged
    funds covers only part of the order.total
    We treat the order as not authorized when the sum of authorized and charged funds is
    0.

    NONE - the funds are not authorized
    PARTIAL - the funds that are authorized or charged don't cover fully the order's
    total
    FULL - the funds that are authorized or charged fully cover the order's total

types.name: OrderChargeStatusEnum
types.description:
Determine the current charge status for the order.

    We treat the order as overcharged when the charged amount is bigger that order.total
    We treat the order as fully charged when the charged amount is equal to order.total.
    We treat the order as partially charged when the charged amount covers only part of
    the order.total

    NONE - the funds are not charged.
    PARTIAL - the funds that are charged don't cover the order's total
    FULL - the funds that are charged fully cover the order's total
    OVERCHARGED - the charged funds are bigger than order's total

enumValues.name: COLLECTION

Sort products by collection. Note: This option is available only for the `Collection.products` query.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: CREATED_AT
enumValues.description:
Sort products by creation date.

enumValues.name: MINIMAL_PRICE
enumValues.description:
Sort products by a minimal price of a product's variant.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PRICE
enumValues.description:
Sort products by price.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PUBLICATION_DATE
enumValues.description:
Sort products by publication date.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED
enumValues.description:
Sort products by publication status.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED_AT
enumValues.description:
Sort products by publication date.

This option requires a channel filter to work as the values can vary between channels.

enumValues.name: RANK
enumValues.description: Sort products by rank. Note: This option is available only with the `search` filter.

args.description:

enumValues.description: A checkout is updated. It also triggers all updates related to the checkout.

enumValues.description: A gift card status is changed.

enumValues.description: An order is confirmed (status change unconfirmed -> unfulfilled) by a staff user using the OrderConfirm mutation. It also triggers when the user completes the checkout and the shop setting `automatically_confirm_all_new_orders` is enabled.

enumValues.name: ORDER_FULLY_PAID
enumValues.description: Payment is made and an order is fully paid.

enumValues.name: ORDER_UPDATED
enumValues.description: An order is updated; triggered for all changes related to an order; covers all other order webhooks, except for ORDER_CREATED.

enumValues.name: PAGE_TYPE_CREATED
enumValues.description: A new page type is created.

enumValues.name: PERMISSION_GROUP_CREATED

enumValues.description: A product variant is back in stock.

enumValues.description: A new product variant is created.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANT_OUT_OF_STOCK
enumValues.description: A product variant is out of stock.

enumValues.name: SALE_TOGGLE
enumValues.description: A sale is activated or deactivated.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_PRICE_CREATED
enumValues.description: A new shipping price is created.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_ZONE_CREATED
enumValues.description: A new shipping zone is created.

enumValues.name: STAFF_CREATED
enumValues.description: A new staff user is created.

enumValues.name: ORDER_UPDATED
enumValues.description: An order is updated; triggered for all changes related to an order; covers all other order webhooks, except for ORDER_CREATED.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANT_BACK_IN_STOCK

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_VARIANT_OUT_OF_STOCK

enumValues.name: SALE_TOGGLE

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_LIST_METHODS_FOR_CHECKOUT

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_PRICE_CREATED
enumValues.description: A new shipping price is created.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_ZONE_CREATED

types.name: WebhookUpdate
types.description:
Updates a webhook subscription. 

Requires one of the following permissions: MANAGE_APPS.

fields.name: webhookErrors
fields.deprecationReason: This field will be removed in Saleor 4.0. Use `errors` field instead.

inputFields.name: app
inputFields.description: ID of the app to which webhook belongs.

inputFields.name: asyncEvents
inputFields.description: The asynchronous events that webhook wants to subscribe.

inputFields.name: events
inputFields.description:
The events that webhook wants to subscribe. 

DEPRECATED: this field will be removed in Saleor 4.0. Use `asyncEvents` or `syncEvents` instead.

inputFields.name: isActive
inputFields.description: Determine if webhook will be set active or not.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The new name of the webhook.

inputFields.name: query

Subscription query used to define a webhook payload.

Added in Saleor 3.2.

Note: this API is currently in Feature Preview and can be subject to changes at later point.

inputFields.name: secretKey
inputFields.description:
Use to create a hash signature with each payload.

DEPRECATED: this field will be removed in Saleor 4.0. As of Saleor 3.5, webhook payloads default to signing using a verifiable JWS.

inputFields.name: syncEvents
inputFields.description: The synchronous events that webhook wants to subscribe.

inputFields.name: targetUrl
inputFields.description: The url to receive the payload.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
